scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. Previously, when one of the team members, Alex, said, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time,' you responded by encouraging the team to stay focused and work together. Now, during a team meeting, [Monica] slams her pen on the table and adds, 'Even if we try our best, there's no way we can meet this deadline.' [Bob] nods in agreement, looking equally concerned.
scenes.description: Monica's frustration is palpable, and Bob's agreement seems to add to the tension. You need to address their concerns quickly.

options.text: I hear you, Monica. How about we identify the most critical tasks and focus on those first?
options.analysis: You acknowledged Monica's feelings and suggested a pragmatic approach to prioritize work, demonstrating high empathy and good emotional perception.

options.text: I understand your concerns. Let’s gather our thoughts and see if we can come up with a different strategy.
options.analysis: You recognized the team's anxiety and suggested a pause to rethink the approach, showing good self-regulation and social skills.

options.text: We’ve faced tough situations before and succeeded. Let’s pull together and prove we can do it again.
options.analysis: You focused on motivating the team by recalling past successes, demonstrating high motivation but lower empathy and emotional perception.
